data.title: Atomic file reference
data.body:
Hey @JoshEngebretson, 

@raheelx and I have implemented a solution to issue #497: Provide a way to jump to objects referenced in the inspector.

These are our concerns:
- EditField Components trigger events onFocusChanged --> We would prefer it onClick.
- The ScrollTo implementation in the ProjectFrame.ts might be unnecessarily complicated.
- Animation components in array widget are not referencing.

Besides these concerns our solution is functional. :) Please let us know what you think!

data.title: Starting Camera in the Scene
data.body: Can we get the camera view in the editor to start at the last place it was when we last save/exited the scene.

data.title: Generated .d.ts files should include comment saying they're autogenerated
data.body: Just like the JSModule generated .cpp files, the automatically generated .d.ts (and any othe language) files should have a comment at the top indicating they're autogenerated so it's obvious they shouldn't be changed manually.

data.title: Material Mixer
data.body:
A Material that allows to combine different materials into one based on a mask. 

Currently if we have one mesh (a car for example) that need different type of materials (Light/Emissive, Metal, Glass) we have to make Sub meshes in order to be able to apply all the different Materials. (Pic 1)

We can also apply different Materials on the polys (This will import one mesh in Atomic and all the Materials) (Pic 2)

With both technique the mesh will have to be model according to the Material and will add extra unwanted polys.

Technique: It should be under a new categories that could be one of those keywords: Special, Miscellaneous, Other, Advance

The Shader Parameter should not affect this Material

Instead of having the Texture field we have a field where we can put the different Materials, a field to put an image for the alpha mask and one for which channel (RGBA) to use from that image (this will allow the artist to have one image for a potential of 4 alpha channels).(Pic3)

The Material Mixer will only display the others Materials depending on the mask.
![materialmixerpic1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11769017/13136645/08d5ed34-d624-11e5-9e5b-c05df3076411.jpg)
![materialmixerpic2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11769017/13136644/08d4daf2-d624-11e5-975f-72ddc5c3d340.jpg)
![materialmixerpic3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11769017/13136646/08d701d8-d624-11e5-83d5-e79ff0da6448.jpg)

data.title: Removing Selected Materials/Textures
data.body:
We cannot remove/delete asset after we assign one. (unless we opened it i a text editor)

Example: If we create a Normal Diffuse Material, then put a Texture in the diffuse field and a Texture into the normal. We cannot empty the normal field even when we change the Material to a simple Diffuse,

Having a X/Cross next to a texture or Materials or anything that allow us to choose a specific asset within our content to remove it

data.title: Materials - Transparencies
data.body:
The transparencies shaders does not work as intended

On the first picture (Alpha), we can see through the meshes
On the second picture (Alpha Mask), the texture get pixelated around the transparency

It also does not seems to pick up the different shade of grays in an alpha channel when using the alpha mask (it read it as a black or white)
![grass_alpha](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11769017/13104923/e90c6b06-d568-11e5-82bc-7b0af6b8fad9.JPG)
![grass_alphamask](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11769017/13104924/e90e41e2-d568-11e5-8bc7-ab2643ee6544.JPG)

data.body: Tested it with three Atomic Examples. Roboman3D, ToonTown and Space Game. Pressing the tab button when in Atomic Player causes a crash. This results in not being able to use the Atomic.KEY_TAB as well.

data.title: Ability to view and edit an imported FBX model's material
data.body:
Artists' request:
Currently the artists are not able to view or edit the default material assigned to an FBX model in the project hierarchy.

Only once the model is dragged into the scene can the material be viewed or changed via the StaticModel compoonent. This is cumbersome when the same model is used multiple times in the scene.

In addition, when importing an fbx model into the Editor the first time... could we have a popup window where one can choose if the default material on the model should be imported or not. This would help reduce the number of redundant materials amongst our resources that gets regenerated every time the cache is rebuilt.

data.title: Imported model normals seem to always be on the convex side of the model
data.body:
An imported model's normals seem to always be on the convex side of the model. The same model's normals import fine in other programs (testing in UE4, Unity, 3ds Max, Blender and Maya). 

![atomic_normalimport](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8994511/12915383/727dfd1e-cf33-11e5-8f20-84074d994b23.jpg)

The attached picture shows the normals of a mesh in blender, and the bottom image displays the resulting light calculation in Atomic.

data.title: Issue #607
data.body:
"Reveal in Finder" changes based on the platform being used. 

PS - Please test this for Mac and Linux as we're working with Windows

data.title: Check that submodules are initialized with build script, if not, initialize them
data.body: Git's default behavior is to not initialize submodules unless told to, we should check whether the submodules are initialized, and if not... initialize them.

data.title: Visual studio project generation failed on secondary storage media
data.body:
I am trying to generate a Visual Studio 2015 project using the .bat file on my F: drive but it is failing to generate the only error i am receiving is as follows:

`jake aborted.
Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, uv_chdir
    at Error (native)
    at process.chdir (F:\Atomic\Build\node_modules\graceful-fs\polyfills.js:18:9)
(See full trace by running task with --trace)`

i have tried running the bat file from cmd with --trace to see if i can get any more detail but it just prints the same.

data.title: Support a default resource Scene/JavaScript which is automatically opened for a project
data.body: This will make the examples  less confusing as if a default scene or JavaScript resource will automatically be opened instead of a blank window

data.title: Change to absolute URL on CEF3 submodule
Ability to use custom shaders/techniques in the Resources directory via the material inspector
data.body:
Our artists would like to be able to write custom shaders, have them under resources rather than in the AGE engine, and apply them from the material inspector.
This would mean the inspector would need to dynamically scan for techniques in the resources and populate the technique list. Techniques would also have to search in resources for shader files.

data.title: Applying MIT to WebView sources
CI build tweaks for the new TS WebView code editor
UIDebugger should work in release builds as well as debug
data.body: Currently the UIDebugger requires some features only available in debug builds for event tracking, etc.  These should be controlled by a flag and not preprocessor defines with care taken that this doesn't affect performance.

data.title: Added water shader example to the welcome screen
ATOMIC-TS-WEBVIEWEDITOR
data.body:
This converts the editor code that lives inside the WebView to typescript to set the stage for further work. 

 In order to do this, Typescript needed to be upgraded to version 1.8 in order to bundle the code into a single file.  There is also a dependency on https://github.com/systemjs/systemjs which is a module loader for the web that is supported by the typescript configuration option: `module: "system"`

The code has a single entrypoint called interop.ts which sets up the functions on `window` that the host needs to be able to reference.  Any api calls the client can call or the host can call should be placed into that interop file and wired up to the `window` object as necessary.

Additionally, since CEF now supports the ES6 spec, the code that is being emitted is emitted as ES6 javascript.  This allows for native support of some of the es6 features such as fat arrows, promises, etc.

Finally, TS 1.8 detected some errors in the editor that were not caught in 1.7x, so those were fixed.

data.title: WebView:  Up and Down arrows don't select google search results on OSX
data.body: To reproduce, open Google search in the AtomicWebView example browser, type in some text until some search results are found.  On OSX, the up/down arrow keys do not move the selection.  This works on Windows. Also, autocomplete selection in the code editor with up and down arrows DOES work on OSX.
